datafield.subfield: Theological Seminary of the Reformed Presbyterian Church (Coldenham, N.Y.)
Theological Seminary of the Reformed Presbyterian Church (Philadelphia, Pa.)
Eastern Theological Seminary of the Reformed Presbyterian Church (Coldenham, N.Y.)
Western Theological Seminary of the Reformed Presbyterian Church (Allegheny, Pittsburgh, Pa.)
(The Theological Seminary of the Reformed Presbyterian Church)
Glasgow, W.M. Historical catalogue of the theological seminaries of the Reformed Presbyterian Church in America, 1898:

p. 15 (Coldenham Theological Seminary; New Alexandria, Pa. was selected in 1836 as the site for the re-organized seminary but never used; est. at Coldenham, N.Y. at the convenience of the professor; in 1838 the seminary was split into Eastern and Western Theological Seminaries)
Glasgow, W.M. History of the Reformed Presbyterian Church, 1888:

p. 82 (Theological Seminary of the Reformed Presbyterian Church; est. in 1810 in Philadelphia with Samuel B. Wylie as professor); p. 741 (discontinued when Wylie resigned, 1817-1822; he was re-elected 1823 but resigned again in 1828) ; p. 105-107 (seminary ordered re-established in New Alexandria, Pa. in 1832; closed by order of Synod in 1838 when Eastern and Western Theological Seminaries were established at Coldenham, N.Y. and Allegheny, Pa. respectively)
